Paper:
we estimate the market beta for stock i, 𝑏𝑒𝑡𝑎𝐹𝑃 =𝜌̂ *𝜎̂𝑖/𝜎̂𝑚
𝜎̂𝑖 and 𝜎̂𝑚 are the estimated stock and market return volatilities, 𝜌̂ is the stock and market return correlation. To estimate return volatilities 𝜎̂𝑖 and 𝜎̂𝑚, we compute the standard deviation of daily log returns over a one-year rolling window. To estimate return correlations,
we use overlapping three-day log returns over a five-year rolling
window

Paper: 𝑟𝑖𝑑 − 𝑟𝑓𝑑 = 𝛼𝑖 + 𝛽𝑖1(𝑟𝑚𝑑−1 − 𝑟𝑓𝑑−1) + 𝛽𝑖2(𝑟𝑚𝑑 − 𝑟𝑓𝑑) + 𝛽𝑖3(𝑟𝑚𝑑+1 − 𝑟𝑓𝑑) + 𝜖𝑖𝑑. rid is stock i’s returns on day d, rmd is value-weighted market returns on day d, and rfd is the risk-free rate (one-year deposit rate). The Dimson beta for stock i, 𝑏𝑒𝑡𝑎𝐷𝑀 = 𝛽 ̂𝑖1 +𝛽 ̂𝑖2 +𝛽 ̂𝑖3. At the end of each month t, we estimate betaDM with the daily returns from month t.
